066/**
067 * Mocked {@link RestClient}.
068 *
069 * <p>
070 *    This class is used for performing serverless unit testing of {@link Rest @Rest}-annotated and {@link Remote @Remote}-annotated classes.
071 *
072 * <p>
073 *    The class itself extends from {@link RestClient} providing it with the rich feature set of that API and combines
074 *    it with the Apache HttpClient {@link HttpClientConnection} interface for processing requests.
075 *  The class converts {@link HttpRequest} objects to instances of {@link MockServletRequest} and {@link MockServletResponse} which are passed directly
076 *  to the call handler on the resource class {@link RestContext#execute(Object,HttpServletRequest,HttpServletResponse)}.
077 *  In effect, you're fully testing your REST API as if it were running in a live servlet container, yet not
078 *  actually having to run in a servlet container.
079 *  All aspects of the client and server side code are tested, yet no servlet container is required.  The actual
080 *  over-the-wire transmission is the only aspect being bypassed.
081 *
082 * <p>
083 * The following shows a simple example of invoking a PUT method on a simple REST interface and asserting the correct status code and response body:
084 *
085 * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
086 * <p class='bjava'>
087 *    <jk>public class</jk> MockTest {
088 *
089 *       <jc>// A simple bean with one field.</jc>
090 *       <jk>public static class</jk> MyBean {
091 *          <jk>public int</jk> <jf>foo</jf> = 1;
092 *       }
093 *
094 *       <jc>// Our REST resource to test.</jc>
095 *       <jc>// Simply echos the response.</jc>
096 *       <ja>@Rest</ja>(
097 *          serializers=Json5Serializer.<jk>class</jk>,
098 *          parsers=JsonParser.<jk>class</jk>
099 *       )
100 *       <jk>public static class</jk> EchoRest {
101 *
102 *          <ja>@RestPut</ja>(
103 *             path=<js>"/echo"</js>
104 *          )
105 *          <jk>public</jk> MyBean echo(<ja>@Content</ja> MyBean <jv>bean</jv>) {
106 *             <jk>return</jk> <jv>bean</jv>;
107 *          }
108 *       }
109 *
110 *       <jc>// Our JUnit test.</jc>
111 *       <ja>@Test</ja>
112 *       <jk>public void</jk> testEcho() <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
113 *
114 *          MyBean <jv>myBean</jv> = <jk>new</jk> MyBean();
115 *
116 *          <jc>// Do a round-trip on the bean through the REST interface</jc>
117 *          <jv>myBean</jv> = MockRestClient
118 *             .<jsm>create</jsm>(EchoRest.<jk>class</jk>)
119 *             .json5()
120 *             .build()
121 *             .put(<js>"/echo"</js>, <jv>myBean</jv>)
122 *             .run()
123 *             .assertStatus().is(200)
124 *             .assertContent().is(<js>"{foo:1}"</js>)
125 *             .getContent().as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
126 *
127 *          <jsm>assertEquals</jsm>(1, <jv>myBean</jv>.<jf>foo</jf>);
128 *       }
129 *    }
130 * </p>
131 * <p>
132 *    Breaking apart the fluent method call above will help you understand how this works.
133 *
134 * <p class='bjava'>
135 *    <ja>@Test</ja>
136 *    <jk>public void</jk> testEcho() <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
137 *
138 *       <jc>// Instantiate our mock client.</jc>
139 *       MockRestClient <jv>client</jv> = MockRestClient
140 *          .<jsm>create</jsm>(EchoRest.<jk>class</jk>)
141 *          .json5()
142 *          .build();
143 *
144 *       <jc>// Create a request.</jc>
145 *       RestRequest <jv>req</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.put(<js>"/echo"</js>, <jv>bean</jv>);
146 *
147 *       <jc>// Execute it (by calling RestCallHandler.service(...) and then returning the response object).</jc>
148 *       RestResponse <jv>res</jv> = <jv>req</jv>.run();
149 *
150 *       <jc>// Run assertion tests on the results.</jc>
151 *       <jv>res</jv>.assertStatus().is(200);
152 *       <jv>res</jv>.assertContent().is(<js>"'foo'"</js>);
153 *
154 *       <jc>// Convert the content of the response to a bean.</jc>
155 *       <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>res</jv>.getContent().as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
156 *    }
157 * </p>
158 *
159 * <p>
160 *    The <c>create(Object)</c> method can take in either <c>Class</c> objects or pre-instantiated beans.
161 *    The latter is particularly useful for testing Spring beans.
162 *
163 * <p>
164 *    The {@link MockRestRequest} object has convenience methods provided to allow you to set any properties
165 *    directly on the underlying {@link HttpServletRequest} object.  The following example shows how
166 *    this can be used to directly set roles on the request object to perform security testing.
167 *
168 * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
169 * <p class='bjava'>
170 *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(roleGuard=<js>"ADMIN"</js>)
171 *    <jk>public class</jk> A {
172 *       <ja>@RestGet</ja>
173 *       <jk>public</jk> String get() {
174 *          <jk>return</jk> <js>"OK"</js>;
175 *       }
176 *    }
177 *
178 *    <ja>@Test</ja>
179 *    <jk>public void</jk> mytest() <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
180 *       MockRestClient <jv>client</jv> = MockRestClient.<jsm>build</jsm>(A.<jk>class</jk>);
181 *
182 *       <jc>// Admin user should get 200, but anyone else should get 403-Unauthorized.</jc>
183 *       <jv>client</jv>.get().roles(<js>"ADMIN"</js>).run().assertStatus().is(200);
184 *       <jv>client</jv>.get().roles(<js>"USER"</js>).run().assertStatus().is(403);
185 *    }
186 * </p>
187 *
188 * <p>
189 *    Debug mode is provided that will cause your HTTP requests and responses to be sent to the console:
190 *
191 * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
192 * <p class='bjava'>
193 *    MockRestClient <jv>client</jv> = MockRestClient
194 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(MyRest.<jk>class</jk>)
195 *       .debug()
196 *       .json5()
197 *       .build();
198 * </p>
199 *
200 * <p>
201 *    The class can also be used for testing of {@link Remote @Remote}-annotated interfaces against {@link Rest @Rest}-annotated resources.
202 *
203 * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
204 * <p class='bjava'>
205 *    <jc>// Our remote resource to test.</jc>
206 *    <ja>@Remote</ja>
207 *    <jk>public interface</jk> MyRemoteInterface {
208 *
209 *       <ja>@RemoteGet</ja>(<js>"/echoQuery"</js>)
210 *       <jk>public int</jk> echoQuery(<ja>@Query</ja>(name=<js>"id"</js>) <jk>int</jk> <jv>id</jv>);
211 *    }
212 *
213 *    <jc>// Our mocked-up REST interface to test against.</jc>
214 *    <ja>@Rest</ja>
215 *    <jk>public class</jk> MyRest {
216 *
217 *       <ja>@RestGet</ja>(path=<js>"/echoQuery"</js>)
218 *       <jk>public int</jk> echoQuery(<ja>@Query</ja>(<js>"id"</js>) String <jv>id</jv>) {
219 *          <jk>return</jk> <jv>id</jv>;
220 *       }
221 *    }
222 *
223 *    <ja>@Test</ja>
224 *    <jk>public void</jk> testProxy() {
225 *       MyRemoteInterface <jv>client</jv> = MockRestClient
226 *          .create(MyRest.<jk>class</jk>)
227 *          .json()
228 *          .build()
229 *          .getRemote(MyRemoteInterface.<jk>class</jk>);
230 *
231 *       <jsm>assertEquals</jsm>(123, <jv>client</jv>.echoQuery(123));
232 *    }
233 * </p>
234 *
235 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
236 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
237 * </ul>
238 *
239 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
240 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestMockBasics">juneau-rest-mock Basics</a>
241 * </ul>
242 */
243public class MockRestClient extends RestClient implements HttpClientConnection {
244
245   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
246   // Static
247   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
248
249   private static Map<Class<?>,RestContext> REST_CONTEXTS = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
250
251   /**
252    * Creates a new {@link org.apache.juneau.rest.client.RestClient.Builder} configured with the specified REST implementation bean or bean class.
253    *
254    * @param impl
255    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
256    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
257    * @return A new builder.
258    */
259   public static Builder create(Object impl) {
260      return new Builder().restBean(impl);
261   }
262
263   /**
264    * Creates a new {@link org.apache.juneau.rest.client.RestClient.Builder} configured with the specified REST implementation bean or bean class.
265    *
266    * <p>
267    * Same as {@link #create(Object)} but HTTP 400+ codes don't trigger {@link RestCallException RestCallExceptions}.
268    *
269    * @param impl
270    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
271    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
272    * @return A new builder.
273    */
274   public static Builder createLax(Object impl) {
275      return new Builder().restBean(impl).ignoreErrors().noTrace();
276   }
277
278   /**
279    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with no registered serializer or parser.
280    *
281    * <p>
282    * Equivalent to calling:
283    * <p class='bjava'>
284    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).build();
285    * </p>
286    *
287    * @param impl
288    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
289    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
290    * @return A new builder.
291    */
292   public static MockRestClient build(Object impl) {
293      return create(impl).build();
294   }
295
296   /**
297    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with no registered serializer or parser.
298    *
299    * <p>
300    * Same as {@link #build(Object)} but HTTP 400+ codes don't trigger {@link RestCallException RestCallExceptions}.
301    *
302    * <p>
303    * Equivalent to calling:
304    * <p class='bjava'>
305    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).ignoreErrors().noTrace().build();
306    * </p>
307    *
308    * @param impl
309    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
310    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
311    * @return A new builder.
312    */
313   public static MockRestClient buildLax(Object impl) {
314      return create(impl).ignoreErrors().noTrace().build();
315   }
316
317   /**
318    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with JSON marshalling support.
319    *
320    * <p>
321    * Equivalent to calling:
322    * <p class='bjava'>
323    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).json().build();
324    * </p>
325    *
326    * @param impl
327    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
328    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
329    * @return A new builder.
330    */
331   public static MockRestClient buildJson(Object impl) {
332      return create(impl).json().build();
333   }
334
335   /**
336    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with JSON marshalling support.
337    *
338    * <p>
339    * Same as {@link #buildJson(Object)} but HTTP 400+ codes don't trigger {@link RestCallException RestCallExceptions}.
340    *
341    * <p>
342    * Equivalent to calling:
343    * <p class='bjava'>
344    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).json().ignoreErrors().build();
345    * </p>
346    *
347    * @param impl
348    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
349    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
350    * @return A new builder.
351    */
352   public static MockRestClient buildJsonLax(Object impl) {
353      return create(impl).json().ignoreErrors().noTrace().build();
354   }
355
356   /**
357    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with Simplified-JSON marshalling support.
358    *
359    * <p>
360    * Equivalent to calling:
361    * <p class='bjava'>
362    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).json().build();
363    * </p>
364    *
365    * @param impl
366    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
367    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
368    * @return A new builder.
369    */
370   public static MockRestClient buildJson5(Object impl) {
371      return create(impl).json5().build();
372   }
373
374   /**
375    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with Simplified-JSON marshalling support.
376    *
377    * <p>
378    * Same as {@link #buildJson5(Object)} but HTTP 400+ codes don't trigger {@link RestCallException RestCallExceptions}.
379    *
380    * <p>
381    * Equivalent to calling:
382    * <p class='bjava'>
383    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).json().ignoreErrors().build();
384    * </p>
385    *
386    * @param impl
387    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
388    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
389    * @return A new builder.
390    */
391   public static MockRestClient buildJson5Lax(Object impl) {
392      return create(impl).json5().ignoreErrors().noTrace().build();
393   }
394
395   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
396   // Builder
397   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
398
399   /**
400    * Builder class.
401    */
402   @FluentSetters(ignore="debug")
403   public static class Builder extends RestClient.Builder {
404
405      Object restBean;
406      String contextPath, servletPath;
407      RestContext restContext;
408      Map<String,String> pathVars;
409
410      /**
411       * No-arg constructor.
412       *
413       * <p>
414       * Provided so that this class can be easily subclassed.
415       */
416      protected Builder() {
417         connectionManager(new MockHttpClientConnectionManager());
418      }
419
420      @Override /* Context.Builder */
421      public Builder copy() {
422         throw new NoSuchMethodError("Not implemented.");
423      }
424
425      /**
426       * Specifies the {@link Rest}-annotated bean class or instance to test against.
427       *
428       * @param value The {@link Rest}-annotated bean class or instance.
429       * @return This object.
430       */
431      public Builder restBean(Object value) {
432         restBean = value;
433         return this;
434      }
435
436      /**
437       * Specifies the {@link RestContext} created for the REST bean.
438       *
439       * @param value The {@link RestContext} created for the REST bean.
440       * @return This object.
441       */
442      public Builder restContext(RestContext value) {
443         restContext = value;
444         return this;
445      }
446
447      /**
448       * Identifies the context path for the REST resource.
449       *
450       * <p>
451       *    This value is used to deconstruct the request URL and set the appropriate URL getters on the {@link HttpServletRequest}
452       *    object correctly.
453       *
454       * <p>
455       *    Should either be a value such as <js>"/foo"</js> or an empty string.
456       *
457       * <p>
458       *    The following fixes are applied to non-conforming strings.
459       * <ul>
460       *    <li><jk>nulls</jk> and <js>"/"</js> are converted to empty strings.
461       *    <li>Trailing slashes are trimmed.
462       *    <li>Leading slash is added if needed.
463       * </ul>
464       *
465       * @param value The context path.
466       * @return This object.
467       */
468      public Builder contextPath(String value) {
469         contextPath = toValidContextPath(value);
470         return this;
471      }
472
473      /**
474       * Identifies the servlet path for the REST resource.
475       *
476       * <p>
477       *    This value is used to deconstruct the request URL and set the appropriate URL getters on the {@link HttpServletRequest}
478       *    object correctly.
479       *
480       * <p>
481       *    Should either be a value such as <js>"/foo"</js> or an empty string.
482       *
483       * <p>
484       *    The following fixes are applied to non-conforming strings.
485       * <ul>
486       *    <li><jk>nulls</jk> and <js>"/"</js> are converted to empty strings.
487       *    <li>Trailing slashes are trimmed.
488       *    <li>Leading slash is added if needed.
489       * </ul>
490       *
491       * @param value The context path.
492       * @return This object.
493       */
494      public Builder servletPath(String value) {
495         servletPath = toValidContextPath(value);
496         return this;
497      }
498
499      /**
500       * Add resolved path variables to this client.
501       *
502       * <p>
503       * Allows you to add resolved parent path variables when performing tests on child resource classes.
504       *
505       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
506       * <p class='bjava'>
507       *    <jc>// A parent class with a path variable.</jc>
508       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(
509       *       path=<js>"/parent/{foo}"</js>,
510       *       children={
511       *          Child.<jk>class</jk>
512       *       }
513       *    )
514       *    <jk>public class</jk> Parent { ... }
515       *
516       *    <jc>// A child class that uses the parent path variable.</jc>
517       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>
518       *    <jk>public class</jk> Child {
519       *
520       *       <jk>@RestGet</jk>
521       *       <jk>public</jk> String get(<ja>@Path</ja>(<js>"foo"</js>) String <jv>foo</jv>) {
522       *          <jk>return</jk> <jv>foo</jv>;
523       *       }
524       *    }
525       * </p>
526       * <p class='bjava'>
527       *    <jc>// Test the method that uses the parent path variable.</jc>
528       *    MockRestClient
529       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(Child.<jk>class</jk>)
530       *       .json5()
531       *       .pathVars(<js>"foo"</js>,<js>"bar"</js>)
532       *       .build()
533       *       .get(<js>"/"</js>)
534       *       .run()
535       *       .assertStatus().asCode().is(200)
536       *       .assertContent().is(<js>"bar"</js>);
537       * </p>
538       *
539       * <review>Needs review</review>
540       *
541       * @param value The path variables.
542       * @return This object.
543       * @see MockServletRequest#pathVars(Map)
544       */
545      public Builder pathVars(Map<String,String> value) {
546         pathVars = value;
547         return this;
548      }
549
550      /**
551       * Add resolved path variables to this client.
552       *
553       * <p>
554       * Identical to {@link #pathVars(Map)} but allows you to specify as a list of key/value pairs.
555       *
556       * @param pairs The key/value pairs.  Must be an even number of parameters.
557       * @return This object.
558       */
559      public Builder pathVars(String...pairs) {
560         return pathVars(CollectionUtils.mapBuilder(String.class,String.class).addPairs((Object[])pairs).build());
561      }
562
563      /**
564       * Suppress logging on this client.
565       *
566       * @return This object.
567       */
568      public Builder suppressLogging() {
569         return logRequests(DetailLevel.NONE, null, null);
570      }
571
572      @Override /* Context.Builder */
573      public Builder debug() {
574         header("Debug", "true");
575         super.debug();
576         return this;
577      }
578
579      @Override /* Context.Builder */
580      public MockRestClient build() {
581         return build(MockRestClient.class);
582      }
583
584      // <FluentSetters>
585
586      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
587      public Builder annotations(Annotation...values) {
588         super.annotations(values);
589         return this;
590      }
591
592      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
593      public Builder apply(AnnotationWorkList work) {
594         super.apply(work);
595         return this;
596      }
597
598      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
599      public Builder applyAnnotations(Object...from) {
600         super.applyAnnotations(from);
601         return this;
602      }
603
604      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
605      public Builder applyAnnotations(Class<?>...from) {
606         super.applyAnnotations(from);
607         return this;
608      }
609
610      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
611      public Builder cache(Cache<HashKey,? extends org.apache.juneau.Context> value) {
612         super.cache(value);
613         return this;
614      }
615
616      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
617      public Builder impl(Context value) {
618         super.impl(value);
619         return this;
620      }
621
622      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
623      public Builder type(Class<? extends org.apache.juneau.Context> value) {
624         super.type(value);
625         return this;
626      }
627
628      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanContextable.Builder */
629      public Builder beanClassVisibility(Visibility value) {
630         super.beanClassVisibility(value);
631         return this;
632      }
633
634      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanContextable.Builder */
635      public Builder beanConstructorVisibility(Visibility value) {
636         super.beanConstructorVisibility(value);
637         return this;
638      }
639
640      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanContextable.Builder */
641      public Builder beanContext(BeanContext value) {
642         super.beanContext(value);
643         return this;
644      }
645
646      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanContextable.Builder */
647      public Builder beanContext(BeanContext.Builder value) {
648         super.beanContext(value);
649         return this;

1826
1827   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1828   // Instance
1829   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1830
1831   private final RestContext restContext;
1832   private final Object restObject;
1833   private final String contextPath, servletPath;
1834   private final Map<String,String> pathVars;
1835
1836   private final ThreadLocal<HttpRequest> rreq = new ThreadLocal<>();
1837   private final ThreadLocal<MockRestResponse> rres = new ThreadLocal<>();
1838   private final ThreadLocal<MockServletRequest> sreq = new ThreadLocal<>();
1839   private final ThreadLocal<MockServletResponse> sres = new ThreadLocal<>();
1840
1841   /**
1842    * Constructor.
1843    *
1844    * @param builder
1845    *    The builder for this object.
1846    */
1847   public MockRestClient(Builder builder) {
1848      super(preInit(builder));
1849      restContext = builder.restContext;
1850      contextPath = builder.contextPath != null ? builder.contextPath : "";
1851      servletPath = builder.servletPath != null ? builder.servletPath : "";
1852      pathVars = builder.pathVars != null ? builder.pathVars : emptyMap();
1853      restObject = restContext.getResource();
1854
1855      HttpClientConnectionManager ccm = getHttpClientConnectionManager();
1856      if (ccm instanceof MockHttpClientConnectionManager)
1857         ((MockHttpClientConnectionManager)ccm).init(this);
1858   }
1859
1860   private static Builder preInit(Builder builder) {
1861      try {
1862         Object restBean = builder.restBean;
1863         String contextPath = builder.contextPath;
1864         String servletPath = builder.servletPath;
1865         String rootUrl = builder.getRootUri();
1866         if (rootUrl == null)
1867            rootUrl = "http://localhost";
1868
1869         Class<?> c = restBean instanceof Class ? (Class<?>)restBean : restBean.getClass();
1870         if (! REST_CONTEXTS.containsKey(c)) {
1871            boolean isClass = restBean instanceof Class;
1872            Object o = isClass ? ((Class<?>)restBean).getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance() : restBean;
1873            RestContext rc = RestContext
1874               .create(o.getClass(), null, null)
1875               .defaultClasses(BasicTestCallLogger.class)
1876               .debugDefault(CONDITIONAL)
1877               .init(()->o)
1878               .build()
1879               .postInit()
1880               .postInitChildFirst();
1881            REST_CONTEXTS.put(c, rc);
1882         }
1883         RestContext restBeanCtx = REST_CONTEXTS.get(c);
1884         builder.restContext(restBeanCtx);
1885
1886         if (servletPath == null)
1887            servletPath = toValidContextPath(restBeanCtx.getFullPath());
1888
1889         rootUrl = rootUrl + emptyIfNull(contextPath) + emptyIfNull(servletPath);
1890
1891         builder.servletPath = servletPath;
1892         builder.rootUrl(rootUrl);
1893         return builder;
1894      } catch (Exception e) {
1895         throw new ConfigException(e, "Could not initialize MockRestClient");
1896      }
1897   }

1983   @Override /* RestClient */
1984   public MockRestRequest patch(Object url, String body, ContentType contentType) throws RestCallException {

2017   /**
2018    * Returns the current client-side REST request.
2019    *
2020    * <p>
2021    * Note that this uses a {@link ThreadLocal} object for storage and so will not work on requests executed in
2022    * separate threads such as when using {@link Future Futures}.
2023    *
2024    * @return The current client-side REST request, or <jk>null</jk> if not set.
2025    */
2026   public HttpRequest getCurrentClientRequest() {
2027      return rreq.get();
2028   }
2029
2030   /**
2031    * Returns the current client-side REST response.
2032    *
2033    * <p>
2034    * Note that this uses a {@link ThreadLocal} object for storage and so will not work on requests executed in
2035    * separate threads such as when using {@link Future Futures}.
2036    *
2037    * @return The current client-side REST response, or <jk>null</jk> if not set.
2038    */
2039   public MockRestResponse getCurrentClientResponse() {
2040      return rres.get();
2041   }
2042

2044    * Returns the current server-side REST request.

2046    * <p>

2071      return this;

2092   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2093   public void close() throws IOException {
2094      // Don't call super.close() because it will close the client.
2095      rreq.remove();
2096      rres.remove();
2097      sreq.remove();
2098      sres.remove();
2099   }
2100
2101   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2102   public boolean isOpen() {
2103      return true;
2104   }

2108      return false;
2109   }

2116      return Integer.MAX_VALUE;

2124      return null;

2128   public boolean isResponseAvailable(int timeout) throws IOException {
2129      return true;
2130   }
2131
2132   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2133   public void sendRequestHeader(HttpRequest request) throws HttpException, IOException {
2134      try {
2135         RequestLine rl = request.getRequestLine();
2136         String path = rl.getUri();
2137         String target = findTarget(request);
2138
2139         HttpRequest req = findRestRequest(request);
2140         rreq.set(req);
2141         rres.remove();
2142         sreq.remove();
2143         sres.remove();
2144
2145         path = target + path;
2146
2147         MockPathResolver pr = new MockPathResolver(target, contextPath, servletPath, path, null);
2148         if (pr.getError() != null)
2149            throw new IllegalStateException(pr.getError());
2150
2151         MockServletRequest r = MockServletRequest
2152            .create(request.getRequestLine().getMethod(), pr.getURI())
2153            .contextPath(pr.getContextPath())
2154            .servletPath(pr.getServletPath())
2155            .pathVars(pathVars)
2156            .debug(isDebug());
2157
2158         for (Header h : request.getAllHeaders())
2159            r.header(h.getName(), h.getValue());
2160
2161         sreq.set(r);
2162         sreq.get().applyOverrides(req);
2163      } catch (Exception e) {
2164         throw new HttpException(e.getMessage(), e);
2165      }
2166   }
2167
2168   /**
2169    * Attempts to unwrap the request to find the underlying RestRequest object.
2170    * Returns the same object if one of the low-level client methods are used (e.g. execute(HttpUriRequest)).
2171    */
2172   private HttpRequest findRestRequest(HttpRequest req) {
2173      if (req instanceof RestRequestCreated)
2174         return ((RestRequestCreated)req).getRestRequest();
2175      if (req instanceof HttpRequestWrapper)
2176         return findRestRequest(((HttpRequestWrapper) req).getOriginal());
2177      return req;
2178   }
2179
2180   private String findTarget(HttpRequest req) {
2181      if (req instanceof HttpRequestWrapper) {
2182         HttpHost httpHost = ((HttpRequestWrapper)req).getTarget();
2183         if (httpHost != null)
2184            return httpHost.toURI();
2185      }
2186      return "http://localhost";
2187   }
2188
2189   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2190   public void sendRequestEntity(HttpEntityEnclosingRequest request) throws HttpException, IOException {
2191      byte[] body = {};
2192      HttpEntity entity = request.getEntity();
2193      if (entity != null) {
2194         long length = entity.getContentLength();
2195         if (length < 0)
2196            length = 1024;
2197         ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream((int)Math.min(length, 1024));
2198         entity.writeTo(baos);
2199         baos.flush();
2200         body = baos.toByteArray();
2201      }
2202      sreq.get().content(body);
2203   }
2204
2205   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2206   public HttpResponse receiveResponseHeader() throws HttpException, IOException {
2207      try {
2208         MockServletResponse res = MockServletResponse.create();
2209         restContext.execute(restObject, sreq.get(), res);
2210
2211         // If the status isn't set, something's broken.
2212         if (res.getStatus() == 0)
2213            throw new IllegalStateException("Response status was 0.");
2214
2215         // A bug in HttpClient causes an infinite loop if the response is less than 200.
2216         // As a workaround, just add 1000 to the status code (which is better than an infinite loop).
2217         if (res.getStatus() < 200)
2218            res.setStatus(1000 + res.getStatus());
2219
2220         sres.set(res);
2221
2222         HttpResponse response = new BasicHttpResponse(new BasicStatusLine(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1, res.getStatus(), res.getMessage()));
2223         res.getHeaders().forEach((k,v) -> {
2224            for (String hv : v)
2225               response.addHeader(k, hv);
2226         });
2227
2228         return response;
2229      } catch (Exception e) {
2230         throw new HttpException(emptyIfNull(e.getMessage()), e);
2231      }
2232   }
2233
2234   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2235   public void receiveResponseEntity(HttpResponse response) throws HttpException, IOException {
2236      InputStream is = new ByteArrayInputStream(sres.get().getContent());
2237      Header contentEncoding = response.getLastHeader("Content-Encoding");
2238      if (contentEncoding != null && contentEncoding.getValue().equalsIgnoreCase("gzip"))
2239         is = new GZIPInputStream(is);
2240      response.setEntity(new InputStreamEntity(is));
2241   }
2242
2243   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2244   public void flush() throws IOException {}
2245}
